At the end of every seven anni, thou shalt make a declaration of libertas, that there shall be a remissio to every creditor, who hath lent his neighbour pecunia.
Thou shalt not exact payment from thy frater, or from thy proximus, or from any of the gens Israel, but thou shalt remit it to him, because it is called the anni of the remissio to Iehova thy Deus.
Of a foreigner thou mayest exact it again: but that which is thine with thy frater, thine hand shall release;
Save when there shall be no pauper among you; for Iehova shall greatly bless thee in the terra, which Iehova thy Deus giveth thee for an hereditas to possess it:
Only if thou carefully hearken unto the vox of Iehova thy Deus, to observe to do all these mandata, which I command thee this day.
Iehova thy Deus shall bless thee, as he hath promised thee: thou shalt lend unto many gentes, but thou shalt not borrow; thou shalt reign over many gentes, but they shall not reign over thee.

If there be among you a pauper of one of thy fratres within any of thy portae in thy terra, which Iehova thy Deus giveth thee, thou shalt not harden thy cor against thy pauper, but thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him, and shalt surely lend him sufficient for his necessitas, in that which he wanteth.

Beware that there be not a cogitatio wicked in thy cor, saying, The septimus anni, the anni of remissio, is at hand; and thine oculus be evil against thy pauper, and thou givest him nothing; lest he cry against thee unto Iehova, and it be sin unto thee.

Thou shalt surely give him, and thine cor shall not be grieved when thou givest unto him: because that for this thing Iehova thy Deus shall bless thee in all thy works, and in all that thou puttest thine hand unto.
For the pauper shall never cease out of the terra: therefore I command thee, saying, Thou shalt open thine hand wide unto thy frater, to thy necessarius, and to thy pauper, in thy terra.
And if thy frater, an Hebrew man, or an Hebrew woman, be sold unto thee, and serve thee six anni; then in the septimus anni thou shalt let him go free from thee.
And when thou sendest him out free from thee, thou shalt not let him go away empty:
Thou shalt furnish him liberally out of thy flock, and out of thy floor, and out of thy winepress: of that wherewith Iehova thy Deus hath blessed thee thou shalt give unto him.
And thou shalt remember that thou wast a servus in the terra of Aegyptum, and Iehova thy Deus redeemed thee: therefore I command thee this thing to day.
And it shall be, if he say unto thee, I will not go away from thee; because he loveth thee and thine domus, because he is well with thee;
Then thou shalt take an awl, and thrust it through his auris unto the ostium, and he shall be thy servus for ever: and also unto thy ancilla thou shalt do likewise.

It shall not seem hard unto thee, when thou sendest him away free from thee; for he hath been worth a double hired servus to thee, in serving thee six anni: and Iehova thy Deus shall bless thee in all that thou doest.

All the firstling males, that come of thy armentum and of thy flock, thou shalt sanctify unto Iehova thy Deus: thou shalt do no work with the firstling of thy armentum, nor shear the firstling of thy flock.
Thou shalt eat it before Iehova thy Deus year by year in the locum, which Iehova shall choose, thou and thy domus.
But if there be any blemish therein, if it be lame, or blind, or have any ill blemish, thou shalt not sacrifice it unto Iehova thy Deus.
Thou shalt eat it within thy portae: the unclean and the clean person shall eat it alike, as the caprea, and as the cervus.
Only thou shalt not eat the sanguis of it; thou shalt pour it upon the terra as aqua.
